official_title: A bill to establish a universal voter registration program.

summary.text: (Reported to Senate from the Committee on Rules and Administration with amendment, S. Rept. 95-171) Universal Voter Registration Act - Establishes the positions of Administrator and Associate Administrator of Voter Registration within the Federal Election Commission. Specifies the duties of the Administrator, including: (1) establishing and administering a voter registration program in accordance with this Act; (2) providing for the collection, analysis, and publication of voter registration information in coordination with the Secretary of Commerce; and (3) providing information and technical assistance to State and local officials concerning voter registration. Requires each State and local government to permit any individual who is eligible under applicable State and Federal law to register to vote in any Federal election, to register on the date of a Federal election at the appropriate polling place. States that any individual so registering shall, if required by State or local authorities, establish his identity by (1) executing an affidavit containing certain information, and (2) submitting either an affidavit executed by a person who is registered to vote at the polling place involved and is present at such polling place with the individual seeking registration or one of any forms of identification approved by the Commission. Requires each State and unit of general local government to provide at each polling place means by which election day registrants can be processed separately from voters who registered prior to election day, except where such separate means of registration would be impractical or unnecessary. Directs the Commission to make grants for approved voter registration outreach programs to States which comply with the election day registration requirements of this Act. Provides formulas for determining the amount of funds each State will be entitled to. Sets forth the multiple uses of funds received for establishing election day registration for Federal election and for State elections. Stipulates the funds received may not be used for any partisan purpose. Sets forth criminal penalties for any person who knowingly and willfully: (1) registers, or attempts to register, to vote under this Act for the purpose of voting more than once in any Federal election; (2) conspires with any person for the purpose of enabling such person to make false registration to vote in a Federal election under this Act or for the purpose of enabling or encouraging any individual to make such false registration to vote in a Federal election; or (3) falsifies any information with respect to the name, residence, or age of such person, or any other information for the purpose of establishing eligibility to register to vote in a Federal election under this Act. Directs the Commission to institute actions to prevent any violation for this Act. Requires Federal courts to expedite consideration of actions involving a violation of, or a constitutional challenge to, any provision of this Act. Prohibits commercial use of any list compiled by a State or local government of individuals registered to vote in a Federal election.
